property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. These concerns will be visible to other participants, and will be used in later sessions to determine how to turn our concerns into suggestions for decision makers. Below, you’ll find a box in which to type your concern. You will be asked to ‘tag’ your concerns, so that others may find your concern more easily. The sidebar to the right of your concerns is your way of seeing what others are writing about. You may navigate by either tags or concerns.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.bct
pgame.title: Review and comment tool
pgame.description: <small>Review overall progress, then comment about moving forward.</small>

props.property:
Overview and instructions

This is the "Review and comment" section of the site. You have two tasks. Expected time to complete this section is 15 minutes spread over two days.

Do you think you used the "Brainstorm concern tool" exactly the same way everyone else did? Your first task in the "Review and comment tool" is to try to make at least two comments. Make a comment about your three tasks and how you a) created keyphrases, b) filtered, voted, and commented on everyone else’s keyphrases, or c) used everyone else’s comments to modify your own keyphrases. Then make a comment about whether you think the most popular keywords/phrases are the best ones. Whenever you are done commenting and voting on other’s comments, your second task is to vote your consent about moving on to Step 2.

Please click "Read More" below to see how you can make at least two types of comments.

Read more

Task one: Review and comment on Step 1 (Suggested time to complete: 10 minutes). You can make at least two types of comments in the "Review and comment" section. Try to make at least one comment about each of your three tasks in Step 1. For instance, 1) Task one: did you find it hard to boil your personal concerns down to 10 words or less? 2) Task two: what made you comment about someone else’s concern keywords or keyphrases? 3) Task three: did you get as many votes and comments on your concern keywords than others did, and did other people help you change your mind? Then try to make at least one comment about whether you think the most popular concern keywords/phrases are the best. You can review the outcomes of Step 1 by sorting concern keywords/phrases using two different tools. You can use the "Sort concerns by:" tool to sort by date added (newest to oldest, oldest to newest); by vote (most agreement, least agreement, most votes); and by comments (most comments, most views). Under the label "Keywords" you can use the tool to sort concern keywords/phrases by ascending order (a-z), descending order (z-a), and frequency.

Task two: Moving forward to Step 2 (Suggested time to complete: <5 minutes). If many people vote no to "Do you think we can move forward?" the moderator may extend the originally scheduled time to complete the step. If you are comfortable with moving forward, vote yes. If you choose not to vote, the moderator will use the rule "silence is consent" and complete the step.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.cst
pgame.title: Concern category tool
pgame.description: <small>Create climate concern categories by clustering keywords|phrases</small>

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.cst
pgame.title: Review and comment tool
pgame.description: <small>Review overall progress, then comment about moving forward.</small>

props.property:
Overview and instructions

This is the "Review and comment" section of the site. You have two tasks. Expected time to complete this section is 15 minutes spread over two days.

Do you think you used the "Categorize concern keywords/phrases" exactly the same way everyone else did? Your first task in the "Review and comment tool" is to try to make at least two comments. Make a comment about the three tasks and how you a) created categories of keyword/phrases, b) voted on other’s categories, or c) used group voting to modify your own categories. Then make a comment about whether you think the most popular categories are the best ones. Whenever you are done commenting and voting on other’s comments, your second task is to vote your consent about moving on to Step 3.

Please click "Read More" below to see how you can make at least two types of comments.

Read More

Task one: Review and comment on Step 2 (Suggested time to complete: 10 minutes). You can make at least two types of comments in the "Review and comment" section. Try to make at least one comment about your three tasks in Step 2. For instance, 1) Task one: did you find it hard to put your favorite keyword/phrases into categories of five words or less? 2) Task two: what made you vote on someone else’s concern categories? 3) Task three: did you get as many votes or comments about your concern categories than others did, and did other people help you change your mind? Next, try to make at least one comment about what you think the most popular concern categories are, whether they are the best, and how they compared with your own concern categories. You can compare your own or your favorite concern categories against the more popular concern categories using the "compare" tool. First, select and highlight your concern category from the list of categories in the left column. Your category will appear in the middle column. Then find a favorite or popular category from the list of categories in the left column and hit the "compare" button. The comparison category will appear in the right column.

Task two: Moving forward to Step 3 (Suggested time to complete: <5 minutes). If many people vote no to "Do you think we can move forward?" the moderator may extend the originally scheduled time to complete the step. If you are comfortable with moving forward, vote yes. If you choose not to vote, the moderator will use the rule "silence is consent" and complete the step.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.cht
pgame.title: Review and comment tool
pgame.description: <small>Review overall progress, then comment about moving forward.</small>

props.property:
Overview and instructions

This is the "Review and comment" section of the site. You have two tasks. Expected time to complete this section is 15 minutes spread over two days.

Do you think you used the "Category hierarchy tool" exactly the same way everyone else did? Your first task in the "Review and comment tool" is to vote on hierarchies and then make a comment about whether you think the most popular categories are the best and the most specific ones. Whenever you are done commenting and voting on other’s comments, your second task is to vote your consent about moving on to Step 4.

Please click "Read More" below to see how you can vote and make comments.

Read More

Task one: Review and comment on Step 3 (Suggested time to complete: 10 minutes). Vote on either your favorite hierarchies or those you think are the best and most specific. Then make at least two types of comments in the "Review and comment" section. Try to make at least one comment about your three tasks in Step 3. For instance, 1) Task one: did you find it difficult to make your favorite concern categories more specific? 2) Task two: what made you vote on someone else’s hierarchies? 3) Task three: did you get as many votes or comments on your hierarchies than others did? Next, try to make at least one comment about whether you think the most popular hierarchies are the best and most specific.

Task two: Moving forward to Step 4 (Suggested time to complete: <5 minutes). If many people vote no to "Do you think we can move forward?" the moderator may extend the originally scheduled time to complete the step. If you are comfortable with moving forward, vote yes. If you choose not to vote, the moderator will use the rule "silence is consent" and complete the step.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.vtt
pgame.title: Review and comment tool
pgame.description: <small>Review overall progress, then comment about moving forward.</small>

props.property:
Overview and instructions

This is the "Review and comment" section of the site. You have two tasks. Expected time to complete this section is 15 minutes spread over two days.

Do you think you used the "Concern indicator tool" exactly the same way everyone else did? Did the technical specialists recommend what you felt were the best indicators? Your first task is to review the technical specialists’ recommendations and then select which indicators you think are best. Then try to make at least one comment about Step 4 or at least one comment about whether you think the most popular categories are the best and the most specific ones. Whenever you are done commenting and voting on other’s comments, your second task is to vote your consent about moving on to Step 5.

Please click "Read More" below to see how you can vote and make comments.

Read More

Task one: Review and comment on Step 4 (Suggested time to complete: 10 minutes). First, simply vote on either your favorite indicators or those you think are the best and most measurable. Then try to make, or vote on, at least two types of comments. Make at least one comment about your three tasks in Step 4. For instance, 1) Task one: did you find it difficult to identify the most specific keyword/phrase to measure? 2) Task two: what made you vote on someone else’s indicators as the best or most measurable? 3) Task three: did you get as many votes or comments about your indicators than others did? Next, try to make at least one comment about how you interpreted the technical specialists’ recommendations, and whether you think the most popular indicators are the best and most measurable.

Task two: Moving forward to Step 5 (Suggested time to complete: <5 minutes). If many people vote no to "Do you think we can move forward?" the moderator may extend the originally scheduled time to complete the step. If you are comfortable with moving forward, vote yes. If you choose not to vote, the moderator will use the rule "silence is consent" and complete the step.
